item.title: How AI is Helping Mushroom Growers Control Climate
item.description:
The Problem We All Face

Well I killed a batch of oyster mushrooms because I didn’t realize how quickly humidity could tank. Went from 85% to 60% overnight—took me three days to notice. By then, the fruiting bodies had already aborted. That’s when I started thinking: what if something could watch these conditions continuously and actually do something before I messed up?

That’s where AI climate control comes in. And no, I’m not talking about some sci-fi setup—I mean actual sensor networks and feedback systems that have gotten smart enough to run themselves.

item.title: Understanding Mycelium: The Hidden Power Beneath Our Feet
item.description:
Introduction

Imagine a world beneath our feet, intricate and vital, yet unseen. This is the world of mycelium, a fundamental component of our ecosystems. Often overlooked, mycelium is a key player in nature’s cycle. Let’s explore this fascinating network that lies under the soil.

What is Mycelium?

Mycelium is essentially the foundation of the fungi kingdom, much like roots are to plants. These thread-like structures, known as hyphae, weave together to form a complex and expansive web. Each hypha is incredibly thin, yet when combined, they create a vast network that can span miles.
